subject: Travel
title: Derinkuyu: Underground City
description: Learn Derinkuyu: Underground City in one minute.

hook.text: A man renovating his basement in Turkey found a tunnel leading to an underground city for 20,000 people.

buildup.text: Derinkuyu extends 18 stories underground. It had schools, churches, storage, stables, and ventilation shafts.

discovery.text: Early Christians likely expanded it to hide from Roman persecution and Arab raids in the 600sâ€“800s AD.

twist.text: Heavy rolling stone doors could seal each level from inside. The city was designed as a last-resort fortress.

climax.text: Over 200 underground cities exist in the Cappadocia region. Most remain unexplored to this day.

punchline.text: A basement renovation uncovered a city for 20,000 people.

quiz.question: How deep does Derinkuyu's underground city go?
